intro: Craspedia richea var. macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind, aiding in its propagation. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms, which remain intact even when dried.
